simplified: Dreams can show you things you think about but don't know. Many people have the same dreams. For example, dreams about flying, falling, or losing teeth. Or dreams about being naked in public. These dreams often mean the same thing for many people. But to know what your dreams mean for *you*, you need to think about your life and feelings every day.

Dreams can give you ideas about things you didn't know you were thinking. Common dreams, like flying, falling, losing teeth, or being naked in public, usually have similar meanings for most people. However, to understand exactly what your dreams mean to you, it's important to connect them to the events and feelings in your daily life.

Moscow has many wild dogs. About 35,000 dogs live in the city streets. Some dogs were born wild. Other dogs were pets, but their owners left them. Some dogs live by themselves. Other dogs live in groups called packs. In 2010, scientists looked at these dogs. They found that the dogs learned to live well in the city. The dogs learned it is safer to cross roads with people. Some dogs even seem to know what traffic lights mean.

Wild dogs living in Moscow are a very interesting example of city animals. Around 35,000 wild dogs live on the streets of Moscow. Some of these dogs were born wild, while others were once pets that their owners left behind. Some dogs live alone, but others live in groups called packs. In 2010, scientists studied these dogs and discovered that they have adapted very well to living in the city. For example, they have learned that it is safer to cross the street when people are crossing, and some dogs even seem to understand traffic lights.

Wonder is a book by RJ Palacio. She is from New York. She got the idea for the book when she saw a girl with a different face. The book sold very well in the USA and won many awards. Schools use it to talk about bullying, friendship, and being different. A movie of the book is being made. Many people want to read RJ Palacio's next book.

Wonder is the first book written by RJ Palacio, who lives in New York. She explains on her website that she got the idea for the book after seeing a girl with facial differences on the street. Wonder has been a very popular book in the United States and has won several awards. Many schools use it to start discussions about bullying, friendship, and what it is like to be different. A film version is now being made, and many people are looking forward to reading RJ Palacio's next book.

Chloe has two pet rats. Their names are Zena and Roxy. Many people think rats are dirty. They think rats are not good pets. Chloe often tells people that rats are clean. She says they are good pets if you care for them. Chloe knows why people don't like rats. She did not like rats before. Her friend Martin had pet rats. He showed them to Chloe. Chloe saw they were loving and smart. Last year, Martin's rat had babies. Chloe wanted two of them.

Chloe has two pet rats, named Zena and Roxy. She knows that many people do not like rats. She often has to explain that rats are not dirty and can be wonderful pets if you look after them well. Chloe understands why people react negatively, because she also disliked rats in the past. However, her friend Martin showed her his pet rats, and she saw how loving and intelligent they were. Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided to get two of them for herself.

Baboons in Cape Town can get hurt. Cars hit them. They can get shocked by electric wires. Baboons are special animals, and there are not many left. So, the city wants to save them. They also want to stop fights between people and baboons. The city has people called "Baboon Monitors." These monitors chase baboons away from houses. Or they catch them and let them go in the countryside. This plan helps a little. But baboons still come back to the city because it is easy to find food there.

Baboons in Cape Town face many dangers. Some baboons get hurt or killed by cars, and others get electric shocks from playing with electric cables. Baboons are an endangered animal, meaning there are not many left. To protect them and stop problems between people and baboons, the city council has hired a team called Baboon Monitors. These monitors either chase baboons out of city areas or catch them and release them in the countryside. This plan has worked quite well, but it is still hard to stop baboons from returning to the city when they find food easily there.

I work for a big computer company. Its main office is in America. I work from home using the internet. I don't have to travel to an office. I don't talk much with co-workers. I work on different projects. This is good for me because I can take time off easily. I can go to my children's school events. I can also go to the dentist. But there is a bad part. I often work late at night because I don't have fixed work hours. Sometimes, I don't eat dinner to finish my work.

I work for a global IT company, but since its main office is in the United States, I do all my work online from home. This means I don't waste time commuting or making small talk with colleagues. I work on a project-by-project basis, and this flexibility is very valuable to me. It allows me to easily take time off when my children need me for school performances or when I have a dentist appointment. The downside is that without clear office hours, I often work late into the evening, sometimes skipping dinner to finish a task.

In the 1990s, people still made graffiti. But street art also became very popular everywhere. Some artists made art to share political ideas. They wanted people to think about war, unfairness, and treating people badly. Other artists just wanted to make pretty art. In South America, many street artists painted in poor places. They made the grey city walls colorful and beautiful.

In the 1990s, graffiti was still common, but street art also became very popular globally. Some artists used their art to express political views, aiming to make people consider issues like war, social inequality, and discrimination. Other street artists focused on creating beautiful and appealing works. In South America, many street artists worked in disadvantaged areas, bringing colour, life, and beauty to plain city walls.

Social media, magazines, and shops show people many things to buy every day. People in Britain are buying more clothes and shoes now. Online shopping makes it easy to buy things. People often buy without thinking. Big companies sell very cheap clothes. People wear these clothes only a few times. Then they throw them away. They treat them like things you use once and throw away.

People are constantly shown things to buy through social media, magazines, and shop windows. As a result, British consumers are now buying more clothes and shoes than ever before. Online shopping allows customers to buy items very easily, often without much thought. Furthermore, major brands sell clothes so cheaply that they are often treated as disposable items, meaning they are worn only a few times before being thrown away.

Sam looked at a car far away. The car made dust. It was going to the Big House. Horses kicked at flies. They did not care that their owner was coming. This was Mr. Carter. He had not visited for ten months. Sam waited. Mr. Carter did not often come here. Sam liked that. Sam wanted to keep his job. He thought it was better to stay away from his boss. Mr. Carter wiped sweat from his neck. His shirt was wet. His skin was red from the sun. He looked like a man who stayed inside and let others work.

Sam looked at the car in the distance, which was making a lot of dust as it drove towards the Big House. The horses kicked at flies with their tails, not seeming to care that their owner, Mr. Carter, was visiting for the first time in ten months. Sam waited. Mr. Carter did not usually come to this place unless he had to, which Sam was happy about. Sam believed that if he stayed out of his boss's way, he would keep his job for longer. Mr. Carter wiped the sweat from his neck. His shirt had wet patches from the sweat. His skin was already turning red from the June sun. He usually looked like a man who stayed indoors and made money while other people did the work.

People in Berlin, Germany, did not like that pigs were shot. They said it was cruel. Hunters and animal lovers argued a lot about this. So, the city council decided to try something else. They stopped shooting the pigs. Now, they put up fences. It is also against the law to feed the pigs. We do not know if this plan will work. There are more pigs now because winters are warmer. So, it might be a difficult fight.

Many people who live in Berlin, Germany, complained that shooting pigs was cruel. This led to many arguments between hunters and animal lovers. Because of these protests, the city council decided to take a more peaceful approach to the pigs. Instead of shooting them, they have put up fences and made it illegal to feed them. It is not yet known if this new strategy will work. It might be a difficult battle because warmer winters mean there are now more pigs than in the past.

Suzanne Collins wrote "The Hunger Games." She got ideas from old Greek stories. She loved the story of Theseus and the Minotaur. In this story, a city called Athens was ruled by Crete. Athens fought against Crete. So, the king of Crete made Athens send 7 boys and 7 girls each year. These young people went into a big maze. A monster called the Minotaur ate them there. But a boy named Theseus fought the Minotaur and killed it. Suzanne thinks Katniss from "The Hunger Games" is like Theseus in the future.

The author of "The Hunger Games," Suzanne Collins, was greatly inspired by classical Greek mythology. One of her favourite stories as a child was "Theseus and the Minotaur." In this myth, the city of Athens was under the rule of Crete. When the Athenians rebelled, King Minos of Crete punished them. He forced Athens to send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people were then put into a labyrinth, a maze, where a monster called the Minotaur lived and ate them. However, a young man named Theseus fought and killed the Minotaur. Suzanne Collins sees Katniss Everdeen as a futuristic version of Theseus.

Zoos let people see animals. Zoos teach people about saving animals. They help people want to protect animals and their homes. Some zoos give a safe place to animals that were hurt in circuses. They also help pets that people left alone. Zoos also study animals. They learn how animals act and how to make sick animals better.

Zoos allow people to see animals up close. This means zoos can teach people about how to protect animals and their natural homes. They can also encourage people to help save animals. Some zoos offer a safe place for animals that were treated badly in circuses, or for pets that people no longer wanted. Zoos also do important studies. For example, they research how animals behave and how to cure their sicknesses.

There is a new idea called 'buy nothing'. It is against buying too many things. This idea started in Canada in the 1990s and then went to the USA. In the USA, people did not want to buy too much on Black Friday and Cyber Monday. These are big shopping days after Thanksgiving. On 'Buy Nothing Day', people protest and cut their credit cards. All year, 'Buy Nothing' groups help people swap and fix things they already have.

A new idea called the 'buy nothing' trend is becoming popular. It is against buying too many things. This idea began in Canada in the early 1990s and then moved to the US. There, it became a way to say no to the excessive buying on Black Friday and Cyber Monday, which happen after Thanksgiving. On 'Buy Nothing Day', people protest in different ways and cut up their credit cards. Throughout the rest of the year, 'Buy Nothing' groups arrange for people to exchange and repair items they already own.

Is graffiti art or is it wrong? People think different things. But in many countries, writing or painting on public or private places is seen as vandalism. This means it is wrong. Police stop artists who make graffiti. Some have to pay money because of it. City governments say it costs a lot to clean graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

Is graffiti art or vandalism? This depends on your opinion. However, in many countries, writing or painting on public or private property is considered vandalism. Many street artists have been stopped by the police, and some have had to pay fines. Many city councils complain about the high cost of cleaning graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

What do people in the art world think about graffiti and street art? Now, more people think it is real art. Big art shows of street art have been in galleries in Paris, London, and Los Angeles. An American artist named Elura Emerald had a street art show in New York in 2008. She said that street artists just show their feelings. They do not hurt anyone. She said people should like and celebrate them.

What do people in the art world think about graffiti and street art? Recently, more and more people have started to see it as a valuable type of art. There have been important street art exhibitions in art galleries in cities like Paris, London, and Los Angeles. In 2008, an American artist called Elura Emerald put on a street art exhibition at a gallery in New York. She spoke up for street artists, saying that 'artists who paint on the street are simply showing their feelings, and they are not harming anyone. People should value and praise them.'

People usually dream 4 to 6 times every night after they are 10 years old. This means about 2,000 dreams each year. When someone is 80 years old, they might have had 140,000 dreams. We forget most of our dreams, about 95 to 99 percent. But we still remember a few thousand dreams in our life. Sometimes, something you dream about happens in real life. This is often just a coincidence. It happens more if the dream is about normal, everyday things.

Most people have between four and six dreams every night once they are ten years old or older. This means they have around 2,000 dreams each year. So, by the time a person reaches 80 years old, they could have had as many as 140,000 dreams. Even though we forget 95 to 99 percent of our dreams, we still remember a few thousand of them throughout our lives. It is not hard to believe that, by chance, something you dream about might happen in real life. This is especially true if the dream is about things that often happen in everyday life.

The story "The Hunger Games" happens in the future. North America was destroyed. The country is called Panem. Panem has 12 poor areas, called districts. There is also a rich city called the Capitol. The Capitol has all the power. Each district makes different things for the Capitol. District 12 makes coal. This is where the story begins. There was a 13th district, but it fought the Capitol and was destroyed.

The story "The Hunger Games" is set in the future, after North America has been destroyed. The country is called Panem. It is made up of twelve poor districts and a wealthy Capitol. The Capitol has complete power over the nation. Each district produces different things for the Capitol. District 12, where the story begins, provides all the coal for the country. There was once a thirteenth district, but it rebelled against the Capitol and was destroyed.

Wild animals often go into cities to find food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons now come into areas where people live. They come to eat. They open trash cans and eat fruit from gardens. Some baboons even go inside houses. They take food from kitchen cupboards and fridges. Baboons can be dangerous. They have hurt many pets. So, many people in the city do not want them there.

Wild animals often come into cities because they are looking for food. In Cape Town, South Africa, baboons have started to enter residential areas on the edge of the city to feed. They open rubbish bins and eat fruit from gardens and orchards. Some baboons are very brave and have even gone into people's houses, taking food from kitchen cupboards and fridges. Baboons can be aggressive and have attacked many pet animals. Because of this, many city residents do not welcome their presence.

Many accidents happen when people build bridges. Engineers sometimes make mistakes. For example, they might calculate things wrong. Then the bridge falls down because it is too heavy. This can kill the workers who are on the bridge at that time.

Many accidents happen when bridges are being built. These accidents are often caused by mistakes made by engineers, such as a wrong calculation. The bridge then falls down because it cannot hold its own weight. This can be very dangerous and even deadly for the workers who are on the bridge at that time.

George Lucas was a film director. He used a special story idea called "the hero's journey." In this story, a hero lives a normal life. Then, something happens that asks the hero to go on an adventure. This adventure changes everything. In the movie Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life with his aunt and uncle. He fixes robots. He finds a message from Princess Leia inside the robot R2D2. This message is for Obi-Wan Kenobi. Finding this message is the "call to adventure" that starts Luke's journey.

George Lucas was one of the first film directors to use "the hero's journey" as a basis for his stories. This journey typically involves a hero living an ordinary life until an event calls them to an adventure that changes everything. For example, at the start of Star Wars, Luke lives a normal life with his aunt and uncle, repairing robots. When he discovers Princess Leia's message for Obi-Wan Kenobi inside the robot R2D2, this acts as "the call to adventure" that begins his heroic journey.

People have an idea to stop dangerous space rocks (asteroids) from hitting Earth. They want to blow them up with a nuclear bomb. This sounds like a movie, like the film "Armageddon." But NASA has a real plan called HAMMER. HAMMER uses big rockets, weighing 8 tons. These rockets would fly to an asteroid. First, they would try to push the asteroid away from Earth. If the asteroid is too close, the rockets would carry nuclear bombs to break it into pieces.

Another idea to protect Earth from a dangerous asteroid (PHA) is to destroy it with a nuclear weapon. This might sound like something from a film, and it was the main idea of the 1998 movie "Armageddon." However, NASA has a real proposal for this, called HAMMER (Hypervelocity Asteroid Mitigation Mission for Emergency Response). This plan involves sending 8-ton rockets towards an approaching asteroid. The rockets would first try to push the asteroid off its path. If the asteroid is too close to Earth for this to work, the rockets would instead carry nuclear bombs to blow it up.

A hero gets a big task. First, the hero does not want to do it. Then, a wise helper comes. The helper helps the hero. So, the hero decides to start the adventure. They go to a special world. In this world, the hero must pass tests. They fight enemies and meet friends. This helps the hero get ready for their biggest challenge. For example, Luke Skywalker's helper is Obi-Wan. His friends are Han Solo, R2D2, and C3PO. His enemy is Darth Vader in the Death Star.

According to Campbell, a hero first gets a call to go on an adventure, but they often say no. Then, a mentor (a wise guide) appears and helps them. After this, the hero decides to start their journey and enter a 'special world' where the adventure takes place. In this world, the hero must pass tests, fight enemies, and meet friends. This prepares them for their biggest challenge. For example, Luke Skywalker's mentor is Obi-Wan. His friends are Han Solo, R2D2, and C3PO, and his enemy is Darth Vader inside the special world of the Death Star.

Some things are not used much. They might seem useless. But other people can use them. The internet started. People online found a way to make money. They do this by sharing things that are not used much. Websites and social media help people buy and sell used things. Now it is very easy for people to share things with each other. This is called the sharing economy.

Things that are not used often might seem unhelpful to some people, but they can be useful to others. Because of the internet, groups of people online found a way to earn money by sharing these things that are not used often. Websites and social media groups help people buy and sell things that have been used before. This makes it very easy for people to share things directly with each other. This way of sharing is called the sharing economy.

I work for myself. I am a freelancer. This is good because I can choose my work and my time. At first, I worked at home. But it was hard to focus. Many things stopped me from working. For example, housework, making tea, and my family. So, I went to a cafe to work. But the internet was not good. I also drank too much coffee. In the end, I rented a desk. It was in a co-working space with five other freelancers. I liked getting ready for work. I could focus well in the office.

I am a freelancer, which means I work for myself. This is great because I have control over my work and my time. Initially, I worked from home, but I found it very hard to concentrate. There were too many distractions, like housework, making tea, and my family asking for things. So, I started going to a nearby cafe to work. But the Wi-Fi connection was not ideal, and I drank too much coffee. In the end, I decided to rent a desk in a co-working space with five other freelancers. I liked getting dressed for work in the morning and being able to focus in an office environment.

NASA wants to find more asteroids that are near Earth. To do this, NASA needs money. The money is for a special telescope called NEOCam. This telescope is 0.5 metres big. It uses infrared light to find the asteroids. If NASA gets the money, it can find these asteroids in ten years. After finding them, a team needs to learn how to protect Earth from very dangerous asteroids. These are called PHAs.

For NASA to find the rest of the medium-sized asteroids near Earth, they need money to build a special space telescope called NEOCam. This telescope is 0.5 metres wide and would use infrared light to find these asteroids. If NASA receives the money, they believe they can find all these asteroids within ten years. Once these asteroids are found, a team that protects the planet would still need to figure out how to defend Earth from the most dangerous asteroids, known as PHAs.

Many people on social media show clothes and makeup to buy. But now, some people say 'buy nothing'. Some YouTube stars tell people not to buy anything for a year. Two friends in Canada tried this. They wanted to buy only food for one year. For three months, they did not buy things like electronics, clothes, or house items. Then, they stopped buying services. This means no haircuts, no eating out, and no petrol for their cars. In one year, they saved $55,000.

The idea of 'buying nothing' has become popular, even with social media influencers. These influencers usually show clothes and makeup that they recommend people buy. However, some YouTube stars now encourage their viewers not to buy anything at all for periods as long as a year. For example, two friends in Canada spent a year trying to buy only food. For the first three months, they learned to live without buying electrical goods, clothes, or things for the house. For the next part, they stopped using services, like getting haircuts, eating out at restaurants, or buying petrol for their cars. In one year, they saved $55,000.

Pi thinks religion is important. His family is Hindu. But Pi wants to learn about other religions. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi says he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. Everyone is surprised. His family and teachers tell him to choose only one religion. Pi says no. He says, "I just want to love God." After that, his family and teachers let him choose his own religion.

Religion is very important to Pi. Even though his family is Hindu, he is interested in other religions. He becomes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. Pi surprises everyone by saying he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian all at once. When his family and teachers ask him to choose only one religion, Pi says no. He tells them, "I just want to love God." From then on, his family and teachers let him decide about religion for himself.

Some people think writing down your dreams can help you have "lucid dreams." A lucid dream is when you know you are dreaming. You can also choose what happens in your dream. For example, you can change a bad dream into a good one. Or you can make your dream like a movie director. So, you can make your dreams, not just understand them. But sometimes, your mind might want to show you things in dreams too.

Some people think that writing down your dreams can help you have lucid dreams. In a lucid dream, you know you are dreaming, and you can also make choices to change what happens in it. For example, you could turn a nightmare into a dream that feels safe, or you could direct the story of your dream like a film director. This means you would be creating your dreams, rather than just trying to understand their meaning. However, you might still want some dreams where your subconscious mind can tell you what's on your mind.

People give old clothes to charity shops. They think this is good. But charity shops cannot sell all these clothes. Some clothes are "fast fashion." These clothes are cheap and not good quality. They go out of style fast. People do not want to buy them again. It is hard to make new things from them. So, many clothes are thrown away. Also, charity shops send many clothes to other countries. This causes problems for money and the environment there.

People often give their old clothes to charity shops, thinking they are helping. However, these shops cannot sell all the clothes they receive. This is often because of "fast fashion," which means clothes that are made cheaply and quickly go out of style. These clothes are often not good enough to be recycled, and people do not want to buy them second-hand. As a result, a lot of clothes are thrown away. Also, many clothes that charities cannot sell are sent to other countries, which creates more problems for their economies and the environment.

Meagan McGrath is from Canada. She likes many adventures. She climbed the highest mountains in the world. She rode a bike across Canada. She ran a long race in the hot desert (45ºC). But her best trip was skiing to the South Pole. On the first day, she fell into ice. Someone saved her. Many people would stop. But Meagan did not stop. She continued. She got to the South Pole 40 days later. She pulled a sled with her tent and food. It was very cold and there were ice storms.

Meagan McGrath from Canada is an adventurer who loves challenges. She has climbed the highest mountain on every continent. She also rode a bike across Canada and ran a very long race in the Sahara Desert, where it was 45ºC hot. However, her most amazing trip was when she skied to the South Pole. On the first day of this trip, she fell into a glacier and needed help to get out. Most people would have stopped then, but Meagan chose to continue her journey. Forty days later, she reached the South Pole. She had pulled a sledge with her tent and all her food behind her, through very cold weather and ice storms.

Blek le Rat started painting rats. He painted them on walls in Paris, his city. Now, he wants people to think about problems in society. He paints pictures of people who have no homes. He does this in big cities. He wants people who live there to think about homeless people.

Blek le Rat began his art by painting rats on walls in Paris, his home city. Today, he aims to make people consider various social issues and problems. He creates paintings of homeless people in large cities to encourage the residents to think about the issue of homelessness.

Some cities want artists to paint graffiti in special places. They don't want artists to paint on all walls. For example, in Taiwan, there are 'graffiti zones'. Artists can paint on walls there. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city lets artists paint on subway trains too.

In some places, local councils have tried to encourage artists to paint graffiti in specific areas instead of randomly on walls. Taiwan is one such place, where there are 'graffiti zones' that allow artists to paint freely. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city council has even given permission for some graffiti artists to paint on the city's subway trains.

Faith47 is an artist from Cape Town, South Africa. She paints big, colourful pictures of people and animals. You can see her art on streets, in old factories, and on old cars. She likes that her art does not stay forever. The weather or city cleaners take it away. She thinks this is like life. Life changes. Things end, and new things start.

Faith47 is an artist from Cape Town, South Africa. She paints large, colourful pictures of people and animals, and she likes to paint in different places. Her art can be seen on pavements, in empty factories, and on abandoned cars. She likes that most street art is temporary. It will soon be removed by the weather or by city cleaners. For her, this shows how life is full of change, with things ending and new things beginning.

Gabriela used to work in a place where bosses had a lot of power. People respected the bosses and their decisions. Workers did not question the bosses. But her new team in Sweden was different. In Sweden, workers and bosses work together. They find answers and make choices together. Bosses help workers, like a coach. They want workers to think for themselves and ask questions.

Gabriela previously worked in a culture where leaders had a lot of power and authority, and people respected this. In that environment, leaders made all the big decisions and were not often questioned. However, her Swedish team was used to a different culture. They worked in a place where employees often work together with their bosses to find solutions and make decisions. Here, leaders act more like coaches or mentors, encouraging people to think independently and expecting them to ask questions.

Gabriela saw that she and her team were different. She talked to them about her way of leading. The team was happy to talk. They said they did not like being told what to do. They liked to work freely and be creative. When Gabriela told them exactly what to do, they felt she did not trust them. They understood that Gabriela felt bad when they changed her ideas. They told her this was how they always worked.

Gabriela noticed that there were cultural differences between her and her team. She decided to talk to them openly about how they felt about her leadership. The team was pleased to be asked for their opinions. They told Gabriela that they were not used to being told exactly what to do. They preferred to have more freedom to make their own decisions and be creative. When Gabriela gave them very specific instructions, they felt she did not trust them to do their work well. They also realized that Gabriela felt upset when they tried to question or change her decisions. They explained that this was simply how they had always worked.

Os Gêmeos are two brothers. They are twins from São Paulo. They paint big, colourful pictures of people. They paint on buildings. Their pictures are very big. They need big machines called cranes to help them. In 2007, they painted a whole castle in Scotland.

Os Gêmeos are twin brothers from São Paulo. They paint many things, from small tags to very large, colourful pictures of people on buildings. Their art is often so big that they need cranes to help them paint. For example, in 2007, they painted an entire castle in Scotland.

People have always painted and written on walls. Long ago, people in Africa and Europe drew animals and people in caves. We found old writing on buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In an old Roman town called Pompeii, people found many writings on walls. These writings were in Latin. They were about religion, politics, love, and even magic.

People have always painted and written on walls. This has happened for a very long time. In ancient times, people in Africa and Europe painted pictures of animals and people inside caves. Old writings on walls, called graffiti, have been found on buildings in old places like Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, experts have discovered many examples of graffiti written in Latin. These messages included things about religion, politics, love, and even some magic spells.

Do you want to climb Mount Everest? Or walk to the South Pole? Many people want to do this. Every year, many people try to climb big mountains. They also try to walk across countries. Old explorers used maps and compasses. Today's adventurers use new tools like GPS and satellite phones. Some adventurers love nature. They travel to help the environment. They want people to know about nature problems. Other adventurers want to help people. They collect money for good causes.

Have you ever wanted to climb Mount Everest or walk to the South Pole? You are not alone. Every year, thousands of people try to climb the world's highest mountains or or walk across continents. Unlike explorers from the past who used maps and compasses, today's adventurers use modern technology such as GPS and satellite phones. Many adventurers are nature lovers who use their travels to help raise awareness about environmental issues. Others want to help people in need and raise money for charities.

There is a project called DART. DART means Double Asteroid Redirection Test. Scientists want to test DART. They will test it on a small moon of an asteroid. The asteroid is called Didymos. Its moon is called 'Didymoon'. Didymoon is 150 metres wide. Didymos is 800 metres wide. Didymoon goes around Didymos. DART will hit Didymoon. They hope this hit will push Didymoon a little. Then telescopes on Earth can see the change.

One project is called DART, which stands for Double Asteroid Redirection Test. Scientists plan to test DART on a small moon that orbits an asteroid named Didymos. This moon, called 'Didymoon', is 150 metres wide and goes around its larger parent asteroid, which is 800 metres wide. The hope is that when DART hits Didymoon, it will push it slightly out of its current path. This change in orbit should be big enough for telescopes on Earth to observe.

Katniss Everdeen is a 16-year-old girl. Her father died, so she must find food for her family. She hunts in the woods near District 12 with her friend Gale. She is very good with a bow and arrow. Also, since World War II, wars have killed many more normal people (civilians) than soldiers. But even for civilians, the numbers are not all bad. People are nine times more likely to die from violent crime than from political fighting. Yet, the number of murders around the world went down. It fell from 8 out of 100,000 people in 2000 to about 5.3 in 2015.

Wasfia helps people. She works for human rights. She saw projects in Bangladesh that helped women and girls. But these projects often stopped, and the women and girls had nothing. Wasfia thought Bangladesh needed to help itself. She loves climbing mountains and helping people. She used these two things to change how people think about women in her country. She started climbing in Tibet and Nepal. Bangladesh is a flat country, so most people there have not seen mountains. Her work is making a difference. People in Bangladesh and all over the world are noticing her.

Wasfia has spent her life helping people and supporting human rights. She saw many projects in her home country, Bangladesh, that taught women and girls new skills. However, these projects often ended, leaving the women and girls with no support. Wasfia understood that Bangladesh needed to be more independent. So, she brought together her two passions: mountaineering and human rights. She wanted to change how people in her country viewed women. She began climbing mountains while working on humanitarian projects in Tibet and Nepal. This was important because Bangladesh is mostly flat, and most people there have never seen a mountain. Her campaign seems to be successful, as people in Bangladesh and around the world are now paying attention.

Many people think poor countries are in a very bad situation. They believe these countries have a lot of poverty. They also think bad leaders rule them, and there is no hope for change. But this is wrong. Things are changing a lot. In the last 20 years, over 700 million people got more money and are not poor anymore. Also, 6 million fewer children die from sickness every year. Many more girls go to school. And many people now have clean water.

Most people believe that developing countries are in a terrible situation. They think these countries suffer from extreme poverty, are led by dictators, and have little hope for real improvement. However, this is far from the truth. A big change is happening. Over the past 20 years, more than 700 million people have increased their income and are no longer living in poverty. Additionally, six million fewer children die from disease each year, millions more girls are attending school, and millions of people now have access to clean water.

Managers give feedback to people at work. They often try to say something good, then something bad, then something good again. This is called a "feedback sandwich." But workers can start to think the good words are not true. They might think the manager is just trying to make the bad news easier to hear. This makes the good feedback less important. Instead, good feedback should be used to help people do good work and do more of it.

Managers often try to make negative feedback easier to hear by putting it between two positive comments. This is a common method. But if managers always do this, employees might start to think the positive comments are not sincere. They might believe the manager is just trying to "sugarcoat" the bad news. When this happens, the positive feedback loses its importance. Instead, positive feedback should be given to truly praise and encourage good work, not just to soften negative comments.

I am in a group called 'Campaign to Stop Killer Robots'. Don't think about movie robots. Think about real machines now. Machines like drones and robot guns are already killing people. Humans don't control them much. Soon, robots might kill people by themselves. They will choose who to kill. This is wrong and dangerous for everyone. We must be very careful about what we ask machines to do.

I am part of the Campaign to Stop Killer Robots. We should not imagine robots from movies, but instead think about what is happening right now. Military machines like drones, gun turrets, and sentry robots are already being used to kill with very little human involvement. The next stage will be autonomous 'murderbots' that follow orders but ultimately decide who to kill by themselves. I believe this would be completely unethical and dangerous for humanity. We need to be very cautious about what we ask machines to do.

Many people learn English. More people learn English than all other languages together. English is also spoken in the most countries. But Chinese has the most native speakers. This means more people speak Chinese from birth than any other language. The number of people who speak a language from birth is not linked to how many people learn it. But the number of people who learn a language is linked to how many countries speak it.

Overall, more people are learning English than all other languages put together, and English is spoken in more countries than any other language. However, Chinese has the most native speakers, meaning more people speak Chinese from birth. It seems there is not much connection between how many native speakers a language has and how many people learn it. But there is a stronger link between the number of people learning a language and how many countries speak it.

Your boss wants to talk about your work on a project. You feel worried all weekend. You think you made mistakes. On Monday, you go to her office. She first says you did good work. You think she will then say something bad. This is like a "feedback sandwich." It means: say something good, then say something bad, then say something good again.

Your manager tells you she wants to talk about your work on a recent project. You worry about it all weekend, thinking you might have done something wrong. On Monday, when you go to her office, she first praises your good work. You wonder if this is the usual praise that starts a "feedback sandwich." You know this method: first, you say something nice, then you say what you really want to say (often a criticism), and then you say something nice again.

Born in the USA is a rock album. The music is fast and makes you want to tap your feet. But the songs also have deep feelings. Behind the happy music, the songs tell sad stories about the American dream. Many songs are about normal people who work hard. They feel angry because they do not get rich or famous. For example, "Glory Days" is about people who remember when they were young and had big hopes. "Downbound Train" is about a young man whose life gets bad after he loses his job. The singer, "The Boss," seems to write about real people he knew. This album shows he is a very talented artist.

The album "Born in the USA" is a fast-paced rock album with catchy music. However, the lyrics of the songs carry a lot of emotion. Despite the lively rock melodies, the songs tell stories about the difficult side of the American dream. Many tracks discuss the struggles of ordinary people who work hard. They feel bitter and angry because their lives do not bring them wealth or fame. For example, the song "Glory Days" is about people in a small town who look back at their youth when they felt they could achieve anything. "Downbound Train" tells the story of a young man whose life is ruined after he loses his job. It seems the artist, known as "The Boss," is writing about real people he knew and the life he might have had if he hadn't become a star. This album clearly shows his unique and extraordinary talent.

Lewis wants to protect more parts of the sea. Now, 3% of the sea is protected. He wants 10% to be protected. This is to fix problems caused by people. People catch too many fish, make the sea dirty, and throw trash. Lewis saw this damage when he went on trips. He saw coral reefs that were white because the water was too warm. He also saw parts of the Red Sea with no life, only plastic. Pugh thinks nature can get better if we give it space. But we must act quickly. If we do not care for our seas, we will soon have a problem we cannot fix.

Lewis wants to increase the number of protected areas in the world's oceans. Currently, only 3% of these areas are protected, but he aims for 10%. This is to reverse the damage caused by human activities such as catching too many fish, polluting the water, and littering. Lewis has personally seen this environmental destruction during his expeditions. He has swum over coral reefs that have turned white due to warmer water temperatures. He has also observed underwater areas in the Red Sea that are like deserts, with no life and covered in plastic. Pugh believes that nature can recover if it is given the chance. However, time is running out. If we do not start taking care of our seas, we may soon face a problem that cannot be solved.

Terrie Sharp is a writer. She writes popular books and won an award two times. She was born in a part of Glasgow where there was a lot of crime. She learned to be quiet and stay safe. She also learned how to open car doors with a knife. But she only used this skill for her books. Now, she talks on TV shows and goes to writing meetings in the UK.

Terrie Sharp is a best-selling author who has won the Olive Crime Writer Award twice. She grew up in Glasgow, in an area that had a very high crime rate. Because of this, she learned to keep quiet, stay out of trouble, and even how to open car doors with a knife. Luckily, she only used this knowledge to write her books. Nowadays, she is not quiet at all. She appears on popular TV shows, like Police Today, and at writing conferences across the UK.

Are things getting worse? Steven Pinker wrote a book called 'Enlightenment Now'. He says that life is actually getting better. We live longer, are healthier, have more freedom, and are happier. But Pinker says there is a problem. People are attacking good ideas like using reason and science. When people make others feel angry or not trust each other, it can hurt important things. These include democracy (when people choose their leaders) and countries working together.

Many people ask if things are getting worse. But in his book 'Enlightenment Now', Steven Pinker says that human progress is real and things are actually getting better. He explains that we are living longer, healthier, freer, and happier lives. Pinker believes the real problem is that important values like reason and and science are being challenged. When commentators or leaders appeal to people's tribalism, fatalism, and distrust, it can seriously damage important systems like democracy and international cooperation.

In old scary movies, people could not call for help. Now, everyone has mobile phones. This makes it hard for scary movies to be scary. So, movies make phones not work. If you are a hero in a scary movie, your phone will not have signal when you need it. Or your phone battery will die. Maybe both.

In older horror films, the main characters often could not call for help or the police when they were in danger. Today, mobile phones make this situation less believable. To keep the suspense, horror films use a trick: no phone signal! If you are the hero in a horror film, it is very likely that when you really need to call for help, your phone will have no signal. Or, your phone battery will die just as you try to make the call. Sometimes, both things happen.

In the 1950s, banana farmers in Central America had a problem. Their main banana, called Gros Michel (or Big Mike), was dying. Now, the next banana, called Cavendish, is also dying. Gros Michel bananas were sweet and easy to move. They had thick skin. A company named United Fruit grew many of these bananas. They grew new plants from parts of old plants, not from seeds. They planted many bananas very close together.

In the 1950s, banana growers in Central America had a serious problem. Their most profitable banana, the Gros Michel, also known as Big Mike, was dying. Now, the same thing is happening again to the Cavendish banana, which took Big Mike's place. The Gros Michel banana was popular because it was sweet, had thick skin, and was easy to transport. United Fruit, the main company that grew and exported bananas in South America at that time, grew them very efficiently. They grew new plants from parts of other plants, not from seeds. They also planted many bananas very close together in their fields.

Spiders have poison. They use it to catch food, not to hurt people. Only 25 kinds of spiders have poison that can hurt people. Spider bites hurt, but people usually do not die. The Sydney funnel-web spider in Australia used to kill people. But since 1981, no one has died because doctors made medicine for its bite. Be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. If they feel scared, they throw out tiny, itchy hairs. These hairs can get into your skin or eyes and make them hurt.

Most spiders have venom, which is a type of poison. They use this venom to catch and kill their food, not usually to attack people. In fact, only about 25 known types of spiders have venom that can actually harm humans. Even though spider bites can be painful, they are very rarely deadly. For example, the dangerous Sydney funnel-web spider in Australia has not caused any deaths since 1981, because a special medicine (anti-venom) was created. However, you should be careful not to bother hairy spiders, like tarantulas. When these spiders feel they are in danger, they protect themselves by shooting out many irritating hairs. These hairs can then get stuck in the skin or eyes of whatever is attacking them, causing discomfort.

This is a common story in scary movies. It was very popular in movies from the late 1900s. The movie starts with a group of young people having fun. But then, everyone dies except one girl. At the start, this girl is usually kind and a bit shy. She is not very strong. By the end, she becomes very strong and smart. This last girl almost always wins.

This is a very common story idea, or cliché, in horror films, especially those made in the late 20th century. The film usually begins with a group of teenagers enjoying themselves. However, by the end, everyone is dead except for one girl. At the start of the film, this girl is often innocent, shy, and not particularly strong. But by the end, she has become the toughest and most resourceful person. This last girl almost always wins in the end.

If we want to know how we got our complex language, we need to look at how our brains are different from animal brains. It's not just about brain size. It's also important what our brains can do, and when and why they changed. We don't have many old things from our ancestors to help us. These old things don't tell us what speech they could make. But we can see how the mouth, throat, and tongue of early humans grew. About 100,000 years ago, humans could make complex sounds. Before that, scientists can only guess if early humans used simple sounds to talk.

If we want to know how we got our ability for complex language, we need to look at how our brains are different from other animals. This is about more than just brain size. It's also important to know what else our brains can do, and when and why they developed in that way. However, there are very few physical clues for this. For example, old objects left by our ancestors don't tell us what kind of speech they were able to make. But one thing we can see in the remains of early humans is how their mouth, throat, and tongue developed. By about 100,000 years ago, humans had developed the ability to create complex sounds. Before that time, scientists who study evolution can only guess whether early humans communicated using more basic sounds.

The Scallion is a free newspaper. It comes out every week. You can find it in university buildings. About 10,000 students read it. Students write and make the whole newspaper. A survey shows that students and staff really like it. They like it for fun, learning about culture, and getting work experience. But printing the newspaper costs a lot of money. Also, some students cannot easily get a copy. They must go to the university to pick one up. Another problem is for the environment. Many newspapers become trash on campus.

The Scallion is a newspaper that is printed every week and given out for free in university buildings. Around 10,000 students read it. Students are fully responsible for writing and producing it. A survey found that both university students and staff value the newspaper highly. They appreciate it for entertainment, cultural learning, and the work experience it provides. However, printing these newspapers is quite expensive. Also, some students find it hard to get a copy because they have to go to the university in person to pick one up. Another problem is environmental: many copies of the newspaper are left as litter around the campus.

Girox Foods loses about 12 out of every 100 workers each year. This is called 'employee turnover'. Other companies in the same business lose only 7 out of 100 workers. So, Girox Foods loses too many workers. This report wants to find out why workers are not happy and leave. It will also give ideas to make the workplace better. This will help more workers stay at Girox Foods.

At Girox Foods, about 12% of employees leave the company every year. This is called employee turnover. This number is higher than the average for other companies in the same business, which is 7%. The main goal of this report is to understand why employees are engaged with their work. Based on this, the report will suggest ways to make the workplace better for employees. This will help more employees stay at Girox Foods.

I agree with what the speaker said. I think that being connected too much can make people feel lonely. This is not a big problem for older people like me. We lived without the internet for a long time. We know how to be alone, and it is fine. But young people (under 20) are different. They spend a lot of time talking online. They do not learn to be by themselves. They do not learn to enjoy their own company. Also, they learn to talk using messages they can change. So, they do not learn how to talk to people face-to-face in real time.

I agreed with much of what the speaker said. I truly believe that the more connected we become, the more isolated we might feel. I don't think this is a big issue for my generation, as we lived without technology for a long time. We know how to be alone, and we understand that it's okay to be by ourselves. But young people under 20 are a different case. They are so busy communicating that they never experience being alone, and they might not learn to enjoy their own company. Also, they learn to talk through messages that can be changed. This means they might not learn the skill of having real conversations face-to-face, in the moment, with someone.

Do not always give good comments and then bad comments. If you always do this, people might not care about the good comments. They might ignore them. Sometimes, just give good comments. Do not add ideas for improvement.

You should not always give positive feedback and then immediately give negative feedback. If you always combine good and bad comments, the good comments might seem less important and people might not pay attention to them. Make sure that sometimes you give positive feedback by itself. Try not to add suggestions for improvement at those times.
